The generator module¶

Python generators help to process ROOT-objects, so you don’t have to load and manipulate wrappers one by one. Many generators are predefined here. They generalize the operations and deliver utility functions. The beauty of this approach becomes apparent when chaining generators. Some chaining (or ‘packaging’) takes place at the bottom of this document, starting with the fs_filter_sort_load generator.

Use the generators within the run() method of your Post-processing tools! Also check out the Examples in Predefined post-processing tools to see the actual application.

Module members¶

cmstoolsac3b.generators.debug_printer(iterable, print_obj=True)[source]¶

Print objects and their type on flying by. Object printing can be turned off.

Parameters:iterable – An iterable with objects
Yields :same as input
cmstoolsac3b.generators.consume_n_count(iterable)[source]¶

Walks over iterable and counts number of items.

Returns:integer
cmstoolsac3b.generators.filter(wrps, key_value_dict=None)[source]¶

Only wrappers with specified attributes can pass this generator.

Parameters:
  • wrps – Wrapper iterable
  • key_value_dict – dictionary of attributes, see cmstoolsac3b_example
Yields :

Wrapper

Example: (Every key in the given dictonairy is tested, where the key is the tested attribute of the wrapper. A single value, a list of values or a regular expression can be evaluated):

filter(
    wrappers,
    {
        "is_data"   : False,                # single value
        "analyzer"  : ["AnaEt", "AnaDR"]    # candidate list
        "name"      : re.compile("histo")   # regular expression
    }
)

If the key_value_dict is empty, all wrappers pass the filter.

cmstoolsac3b.generators.rejector(wrps, key_value_dict=None)[source]¶

Just as filter, only rejects items with the given properites.

cmstoolsac3b.generators.callback(wrps, func=None, filter_dict=None)[source]¶

Do a special treatment for selected wrps! All wrps are yielded.

Parameters:
  • wrps – Wrapper iterable
  • filter_dict – same as key_value_dict in filter(..) above
  • func – callable
Yields :

Wrapper

Example: If you wanted to color all passing MC histograms blue:

def make_blue(wrp):
    wrp.histo.SetFillColor(ROOT.kBlue)

callback(
    wrappers,
    make_blue
    {"is_data": False}
)
cmstoolsac3b.generators.sort(wrps, key_list=None)[source]¶

Sort stream after items in key_list. Loads full stream into memory.

Parameters:
  • wrps – Wrapper iterable
  • key_list – (List of) token(s) after which the stream is sorted. First item has highest importance. If None, then ['analyzer', 'name', 'is_data', 'sample'] is used.
Returns:

sorted list of wrappers.
cmstoolsac3b.generators.group(wrps, key_func=None)[source]¶

Clusters stream into groups. wrps should be sorted.

Parameters:
  • wrps – Wrapper iterable
  • key_func – callable to group the wrappers. If None, then lambda w: w.analyzer + "_" + w.name is used.
Yields :

Wrapper

Example: This is neccessary before stacking, in order to have only same-observable-histograms stacked together:

# wrappers has the names ["h1", "h1", "h2", "h2"]
wrappers = group(wrappers)
# result is like: [ ("h1", "h1"), ("h2", "h2") ]
cmstoolsac3b.generators.interleave(*grouped_wrps)[source]¶

Like itertools.izip, but chains inner packaging. Useful before making canvasses.

((a,b),(c,d)), ((1,2),(3,4)) => ((a,b,1,2), (c,d,3,4))

Parameters:*grouped_wrps –

grouped iterators
Yields :generator object
cmstoolsac3b.generators.split_data_mc(wrps)[source]¶

Split stream into data and mc stream.

Parameters:wrps – Wrapper iterable
Returns:two wrapper iterators: (stream_data, stream_mc)
cmstoolsac3b.generators.debug_print(wrps, prefix='DEBUG ')[source]¶

Prints all passing items.

Implementation:

for wrp in wrps:
    print prefix, wrp.all_info()
    yield wrp
cmstoolsac3b.generators.generate_op(op_func)[source]¶

Transforms an operation with one argument into a generator.

Parameters:op_func – callable
Returns:generator

Example: The lumi and integral operations are generatorized below (notice that w1,``w2`` and w3 are iterables):

>>> from ROOT import TH1I
>>> from cmstoolsac3b.wrappers import HistoWrapper
>>> h1 = TH1I("h1", "", 2, .5, 4.5)
>>> h1.Fill(1)
1
>>> h1.Fill(3)
2
>>> w1 = [HistoWrapper(h1, lumi=2.)]
>>> gen_lumi = generate_op(op.lumi)
>>> w2 = list(gen_lumi(w1))
>>> w2[0].float
2.0
>>> gen_int = generate_op(op.integral)
>>> w3 = list(gen_int(w1))
>>> w3[0].float
2.0
>>> w4 = list(gen_int(w1, useBinWidth=True))
>>> w4[0].float
4.0
cmstoolsac3b.generators.gen_stack(wrps, **kws)¶

This is generate_op(cmstoolsac3b.operations.stack)

cmstoolsac3b.generators.gen_sum(wrps, **kws)¶

Parameters:wrps – Wrapper iterable
Yields :Wrapper
cmstoolsac3b.generators.pool_consume_n_count(wrps)[source]¶

Consumes wrappers into pool.

Implementation:

return consume_n_count(pool_store_items(wrps))
cmstoolsac3b.generators.load(aliases)[source]¶

Loads histograms in histowrappers for aliases.

Parameters:aliases – Alias iterable
Yields :HistoWrapper
cmstoolsac3b.generators.save(wrps, filename_func, suffices=None)[source]¶

Saves passing wrps to disk, plus .info file with the wrapper infos.

Parameters:
  • wrps – Wrapper iterable
  • filename_func – callable that returns path and filename without suffix.
  • suffices – list of suffices

Example:

save(
    wrappers,
    lambda wrp: OUTPUT_DIR + wrp.name,
    [.root, .png]           # DEFAULT: settings.rootfile_postfixes
)

cmstoolsac3b.generators.make_canvas_builder(grps)[source]¶

Yields instanciated CanvasBuilders.

Parameters:grps – grouped or ungrouped Wrapper iterable if grouped: on canvas for each group
Yields :CanvasBuilder instance
cmstoolsac3b.generators.decorate(wrps, decorators=None)[source]¶

Decorate any iterable with a list of decorators.

Parameters:
  • wrps – Wrapper (or CanvasBuilder) iterable
  • decorators – list of decorator classes.
Yields :

Wrapper (or CanvasBuilder)

Example:

result = decorate([CanvasBuilder, ...], [Legend, TextBox])
# result = [Legend(TextBox(CanvasBuilder)), ...]
cmstoolsac3b.generators.build_canvas(bldrs)[source]¶

Calls the build_canvas() method and returns the result.

Parameters:bldrs – CanvasBuilder iterable
Yields :CanvasWrapper

  • x_axis – boolean for x axis
  • y_axis – boolean for y axis

CanvasWrapper
cmstoolsac3b.generators.fs_filter_sort_load(filter_dict=None, sort_keys=None)[source]¶

Packaging of filtering, sorting and loading.

Parameters:
  • filter_dict – see function filter(...) above
  • sort_keys – see function sort(...) above
Yields :

HistoWrapper

Implementation:

wrps = fs_content()
wrps = filter(wrps, filter_dict)
wrps = sort(wrps, key_list)
return load(wrps)
cmstoolsac3b.generators.mc_stack(wrps, merge_mc_key_func=None)[source]¶

Delivers only MC stacks, feed only with MC.

Parameters:
  • wrps – Iterables of HistoWrapper (grouped)
  • merge_mc_key_func – key function for python sorted(...), default tries to sort after stack position
Yields :

StackWrapper
cmstoolsac3b.generators.fs_mc_stack(filter_dict=None, merge_mc_key_func=None)[source]¶

Delivers only MC stacks, no data, from fileservice.

Parameters:
  • filter_dict – see function filter(...) above
  • merge_mc_key_func – key function for python sorted(...), default tries to sort after stack position
Yields :

StackWrapper
cmstoolsac3b.generators.mc_stack_n_data_sum(wrps, merge_mc_key_func=None)[source]¶

Stacks MC histos and merges data, input needs to be sorted and grouped.

The output are tuples of MC stacks and data histograms. ATTENTION: This crashes, if the proper histograms are not present!

Parameters:
  • wrps – Iterables of HistoWrapper (grouped)
  • merge_mc_key_func – key function for python sorted(...), default tries to sort after stack position
Yields :

(StackWrapper, HistoWrapper)
cmstoolsac3b.generators.fs_mc_stack_n_data_sum(filter_dict=None, merge_mc_key_func=None)[source]¶

The full job to stacked histos and data, directly from fileservice.

The output are tuples of MC stacks and data histograms. ATTENTION: This crashes, if the proper histograms are not present!

Parameters:
  • filter_dict – see function filter(...) above
  • merge_mc_key_func – key function for python sorted(...), default tries to sort after stack position
Yields :

(StackWrapper, HistoWrapper)
cmstoolsac3b.generators.canvas(grps, decorators=[], callback_filter=None, callback_func=None)[source]¶

Packaging of canvas builder, decorating, callback and canvas building.

Parameters:
  • grps – grouped or ungrouped Wrapper iterable if grouped: on canvas for each group
  • decorators – see function decorate(...) above
  • callback_filter – see function callback(...) above (param filter_dict there)
  • callback_func – see function callback(...) above
Yields :

CanvasWrapper
